```{r}
split_protein_data <- sapply(protein_data, function(seq) {
  # Split sequence into individual amino acids
  amino_acids <- unlist(strsplit(seq, ""))
  return(amino_acids)
})
```




```{r}
amino_acids <- c("A", "C", "D", "E", "F", "G", "H", "I", "K", "L", "M", "N", "P", "Q", "R", "S", "T", "V", "W", "Y")

# Initialize DDG_input dataframe
DDG_input <- data.frame(seq_name = character(0), combo = character(0), stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

for(seq_name in names(split_protein_data)) {
  sequence <- split_protein_data[[seq_name]]
  for(pos in 1:length(sequence)) {
    residue <- sequence[pos]
    for(aa in amino_acids) {
      combo <- paste0(residue, pos, ".", "{", aa, "}")
      DDG_input <- rbind(DDG_input, data.frame(seq_name = seq_name, combo = combo, stringsAsFactors = FALSE))
    }
  }
}

print(DDG_input)


```



```{r}
print_combos_by_seq_name <- function(target_seq_name, df) {
  combos_for_seq <- subset(df, seq_name == target_seq_name)$combo
  
  # Print each combo for the specified sequence on a separate line
  for(combo in combos_for_seq) {
    cat(combo, "\n")
  }
}

# Example usage
print_combos_by_seq_name("BRCA1", DDG_input)



```

#Polyphen
```{r}
uniportID <-c('P04637', "Q00987", "P38398", "Q99728", "P01112", "P04049", "P28482", "Q16828", "P20248", "P24941", "P51587", "Q06609", "P60568", "P01589", "P15884", "P35222", "Q14209", "P06400", "P01133", "P00533")

protein_pp <- data.frame(protein_names,uniportID)
```


```{r}
amino_acids <- c("A", "C", "D", "E", "F", "G", "H", "I", "K", "L", "M", "N", "P", "Q", "R", "S", "T", "V", "W", "Y")

# Initialize an empty named list to store formatted strings
formatted_output_list <- list()

# Iterate over each sequence in protein_pp
for(uniport in names(protein_pp)) {
  sequence <- protein_pp[uniport]
  uniport_output <- character(0)  # Initialize a vector for this UniProt ID
  
  # Iterate over each residue in the sequence
  for(pos in 1:nchar(sequence)) {
    residue <- substr(sequence, pos, pos)
    for(aa in amino_acids) {
      # Create a formatted string for each amino acid substitution
      output_string <- paste(uniport, pos, residue, aa)
      uniport_output <- c(uniport_output, output_string)
    }
  }
  
  # Add this UniProt ID's output to the list
  formatted_output_list[[uniport]] <- uniport_output
}
```

```{r}
# Example: Retrieve the formatted output for a specific UniProt ID
desired_uniport_id <- "P06400"
cat(paste(formatted_output_list[[desired_uniport_id]], collapse = "\n"))
```
